result.name: ENGLISH, B.A. - Subject Matter Program for Single Subject Credential

templateAssets.content:
This agreement displays all lower-division courses required in the major: CSU Northridge courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right. General education (Cal-GETC or CSU Northridge GE) and upper-division courses are also required to complete the bachelor's degree.


Completion of all coursework listed in this agreement is not mandatory prior to admission. For CSU Northridge Undergraduate Admission Requirements, refer to Upper Division Transfer.


Some coursework may be satisfied by Advanced Placement exams completed in high school. Visit AP Credit for information. Additional information about the major is available in the CSUN University Catalog.


Questions regarding this agreement may be directed to: articulation@csun.edu.

course.courseTitle: Survey of Mexican Literature in Translation

templateAssets.content:
Designed for prospective secondary school English teachers. Students receive a B.A. in English and a single-subject competency verification by completing the approved coursework with no grade below a "C" and maintaining a GPA of 2.99 or better. See Program Requirements for complete details.


Extended Study: Students must choose an Extended Study Emphasis. Depending upon the emphasis chosen, the following lower division courses (or articulated transfer courses) may apply:

  • Communication Studies Extended Study: Literature in Performance; Argumentation
  • Creative Writing Extended Study: Creative Writing
  • Linguistics and Diversity Extended Study: How Language Matters; Language(s) in California
  • Literature Extended Study - No Lower Division Courses
  • Literatures of Diversity Extended Study: Survey of Asian American Literature OR Survey of Mexican Literature in Translation
  • Popular Culture - Bestselling Literature OR Popular Literary Genres
  • Rhetoric and Composition Extended Study - No Lower Division Courses
  • Theatre Extended Study: Actors and Acting
